alert.note: Alert for Somerset; Wicomico; Worcester (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 07 at 10:28PM EDT until August 07 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN SOMERSET...SOUTHWESTERN WICOMICO AND WEST CENTRAL WORCESTER COUNTIES... At 1028 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Fruitland around 1035 PM EDT. Salisbury University around 1040 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Green Hill, Catchpenny, Wetipquin, Trinity, Royal Oak, Eden, Allen, Whitehaven, Lakewood, and Widgeon. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
